intro: Manulea leptosiphon, commonly known as the slender-siphon manulea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
